subject: SUNSHINE FOR YOUR SOUL
verse: For the Lord God is a sun and a shield; the Lord bestows favor and honor; no good thing does He withhold from those whose walk is blameless. (Psalms 84:11)
reflection: I prefer sunny days, but I am not a sun-worshiper. Instead, I'm a worshiper of God's Son, who shines brightly in all who believe in Him what ever the weather. Which kind of worshiper are you? LASTING HAPPINESS DOESN'T COME FROM SUNNY DAYS BUT FROM THE SON OF GOD.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 8:2:19:

_For the Lord God is a sun and a shield; the Lord bestows _

_favor and honor; no good thing does He withhold from _

_those whose walk is blameless. _(Ps. 84:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

I prefer sunny days, but I am not a sun-worshiper. Instead,

I'm a worshiper of God's Son, who shines brightly in all

who believe in Him what ever the weather. Which kind of

worshiper are you? LASTING HAPPINESS DOESN'T COME FROM

SUNNY DAYS BUT FROM THE SON OF GOD.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: THE LISTENING PRAYER
verse: Teach me Your way, Lord, that I may rely on Your faithfulness; give me an undivided heart, that I may fear your name. (Psalms 86:11)
reflection: Prayer is not a way of making use of God; prayer is a way of offering ourselves to God in order that He should be able to make use of us. It may be that one of our great faults in prayer is that we talk too much and listen to little. When prayer is at its highest we should wait in silence for God's voice to us. We might call this a "listening prayer," and it is a practice we nee to develop. GOD SPEAKS THROUGH HIS WORD--TAKE TIME TO LISTEN.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Teach me Your way, Lord, that I may rely on_

_Your faithfulness; give me an undivided heart,_

_that I may fear your name. _(Ps. 86:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Prayer is not a way of making use of God; prayer

is a way of offering ourselves to God in order that

He should be able to make use of us. It may be that

one of our great faults in prayer is that we talk too

much and listen to little. When prayer is at its highest

we should wait in silence for God's voice to us. We

might call this a "listening prayer," and it is a practice

we nee to develop.

GOD SPEAKS THROUGH HIS WORD--TAKE TIME TO LISTEN.

_ PASTOR AL _
